items.title: Hamas will have ‘hell to pay’ if it fails to disarm, Trump warns after Netanyahu meeting
items.standfirst: Israeli prime minister said he will award Trump with Israel prize, highest civilian honor, while visiting Mar-a-LagoUS politics live – latest updatesDonald Trump has warned that Hamas will have “hell to pay” if it fails to disarm while offering full-throated support to Benjamin Netanyahu during a meeting with the Israeli prime minister in Florida.In a bravura display of mutual admiration, Netanyahu announced that the US president would be awarded the Israel prize, the country’s highest civilian honour, which since its inception in the 1950s has never before been given to a non-Israeli person. Continue reading...

Then, Mona Yacoubian, director of the Middle East Program at the Center for Strategic and International Studies, joins with analysis.

items.content: They planned to discuss Iran, Lebanon, Syria and Gaza, where the Trump administration wants to see the ceasefire enter its second stage in January.

items.title: Special Report: Trump meets with Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu at Mar-a-Lago
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump met with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu at Mar-a-Lago to discuss the ceasefire in Gaza and new actions against Iran. NBC News' Gabe Gutierrez has details on what the president said and what the two leaders are expected to discuss.
items.content: President Donald Trump met with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu at Mar-a-Lago to discuss the ceasefire in Gaza and new actions against Iran. NBC News' Gabe Gutierrez has details on what the president said and what the two leaders are expected to discuss.

items.title: Netanyahu to discuss Gaza ceasefire with Trump without 'antagonising his base back home'
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump is expected to ⁠push for progress in the stalled ceasefire in Gaza when he meets with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu for talks on December 29 that will include Israel's concerns over Hezbollah in Lebanon and Iran. For Netanyahu, the meeting comes amid domestic dissatisfaction over his management of the situation. FRANCE 24's Noga Tarnopolsky tells us what's at stake for the Israeli PM straight from Jerusalem.
items.content: US President Donald Trump is expected to ⁠push for progress in the stalled ceasefire in Gaza when he meets with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu for talks on December 29 that will include Israel's concerns over Hezbollah in Lebanon and Iran. For Netanyahu, the meeting comes amid domestic dissatisfaction over his management of the situation. FRANCE 24's Noga Tarnopolsky tells us what's at stake for the Israeli PM straight from Jerusalem.

items.title: Gaza truce: Where does it stand and what's supposed to happen under phase two?
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu are meeting in Florida for talks that will cover the next phase of the Gaza ceasefire deal. Washington wants to see it move to the second phase in January 2026, but Israel and Hamas both accuse each other of breaching the first phase of the agreement. Andrew Hilliar breaks down where the deal currently stands and what's supposed to happen in phase two.
items.content: US President Donald Trump and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu are meeting in Florida for talks that will cover the next phase of the Gaza ceasefire deal. Washington wants to see it move to the second phase in January 2026, but Israel and Hamas both accuse each other of breaching the first phase of the agreement. Andrew Hilliar breaks down where the deal currently stands and what's supposed to happen in phase two.

items.title: Netanyahu and Trump to meet for talks on Gaza peace plan and Iran
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is set to meet Donald Trump in Florida on December 29, with the US president pushing to move to the next stage of his fragile Gaza truce plan. Netanyahu is also expected to try to shift some focus onto Iran, amid reports he will call for more US strikes on the Islamic republic. FRANCE 24's Angela Diffley tells us more on what to expect from this meeting.
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is set to meet Donald Trump in Florida on December 29, with the US president pushing to move to the next stage of his fragile Gaza truce plan. Netanyahu is also expected to try to shift some focus onto Iran, amid reports he will call for more US strikes on the Islamic republic. FRANCE 24's Angela Diffley tells us more on what to expect from this meeting.

items.title: Anthony Joshua’s camp confirm two of his close friends died in car crash
items.standfirst: Two members of Joshua’s team died in Nigeria crashBritish former boxing champion sustained minor injuriesThe British heavyweight boxer Anthony Joshua has issued a statement after he was injured in a car crash in Nigeria on Monday morning which killed two of his close friends.The former world heavyweight boxing champion was taken to an undisclosed hospital after his car hit a stationary vehicle at about 11am on the Lagos-Ibadan Expressway, the Ogun state police commissioner, Lanre Ogunlowo, said. The driver of Joshua’s vehicle was also injured, he added. Continue reading...

items.title: Russia says Ukraine attacked Putin's home, Kyiv calls this 'lie'
items.standfirst: Russia accused Ukraine on Monday of having fired dozens of drones at one of President Vladimir Putin's homes, an accusation that Ukraine called a "lie" aimed at undermining US-led efforts to end the war. Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov, who does not typically announce drone strikes, said Ukraine had fired "91 long-range unmanned aerial vehicles" at Putin's residence in the Novgorod region between late Sunday and early Monday, all of which were shot down.
items.content: Russia accused Ukraine on Monday of having fired dozens of drones at one of President Vladimir Putin's homes, an accusation that Ukraine called a "lie" aimed at undermining US-led efforts to end the war. Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov, who does not typically announce drone strikes, said Ukraine had fired "91 long-range unmanned aerial vehicles" at Putin's residence in the Novgorod region between late Sunday and early Monday, all of which were shot down.

items.title: Zelenskyy accuses Russia of trying to sabotage peace talks with ‘typical Russian lies’
items.standfirst: Russia’s claim it foiled drone attack on Putin residence shows ‘they do not want to finish this war’, Ukrainian president saysVolodymyr Zelenskyy has accused Russia of trying to sabotage peace talks and preparing to bomb government buildings after the Kremlin said it had foiled a Ukrainian drone attack on Vladimir Putin’s residence.Zelenskyy described the claim as “typical Russian lies” following his two-hour meeting on Sunday with Donald Trump in Florida. He said Russia was “at it again” and using “dangerous statements” to undermine “diplomatic efforts” with the US to end the conflict. Continue reading...

He said Russia was “at it again” and using “dangerous statements” to undermine “diplomatic efforts” with the US to end the conflict. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: Zelenskyy says Moscow trying to derail peace talks progress, as Russian foreign minister claims Ukraine targeted president’s home in NovgorodThe Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov told journalists this morning that Moscow agreed with Donald Trump’s assessment that talks to end the war were in their final stage.As a reminder, Trump said a draft agreement to end the war was nearly “95% done”. “I really think we are closer than ever with both sides,” he said, though he added that “one or two very thorny issues” remain. Continue reading...

items.content: Donald Trump has offered Ukraine security guarantees for 15 years as part of a proposed plan to end Russia's invasion, Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said.

items.title: The U.S. offers Ukraine a 15-year security guarantee for now, Zelenskyy says
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the United States is offering his country security guarantees for 15 years as part of a proposed peace plan.
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the United States is offering his country security guarantees for 15 years as part of a proposed peace plan.(Image credit: Alex Brandon)

items.title: Ukraine: What is blocking the peace deal negotiations?
items.standfirst: Speaking at a joint press conference, both US President Donald Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky were cautiously optimistic about negotiations over the 20-point peace plan for Ukraine. But progress made doesn't include issues of security guarantees for Ukraine, nor the country's eastern Donbas region. So what is blocking the negotiations?
items.content: Speaking at a joint press conference, both US President Donald Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky were cautiously optimistic about negotiations over the 20-point peace plan for Ukraine. But progress made doesn't include issues of security guarantees for Ukraine, nor the country's eastern Donbas region. So what is blocking the negotiations?

items.title: US offered Ukraine a 15-year security guarantee, Zelensky said after talks with Trump
items.standfirst: The US has offered Ukraine "solid" security guarantees for the next 15 years with the possibility of an extension, Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky said Monday after talks with the US president at his Mar-a-Lago residence in Florida. Kyiv is seeking guarantees for a longer time period.
items.content: The US has offered Ukraine "solid" security guarantees for the next 15 years with the possibility of an extension, Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky said Monday after talks with the US president at his Mar-a-Lago residence in Florida. Kyiv is seeking guarantees for a longer time period.

items.title: 'One or two thorny issues' remain after Ukraine peace deal talks, Trump says
items.standfirst: Donald Trump and Volodymyr Zelenskyy say they have made "a lot of progress" towards finalising a peace agreement to end Russia's war in Ukraine - although "one or two very thorny issues" remain.
items.content: Donald Trump and Volodymyr Zelenskyy say they have made "a lot of progress" towards finalising a peace agreement to end Russia's war in Ukraine - although "one or two very thorny issues" remain.

items.title: SoftBank to Buy Data Center Firm DigitalBridge for $3 Billion
SoftBank to Buy Data Center Investment Firm DigitalBridge for $4 Billion
SoftBank to acquire DigitalBridge for $4bn in move to deepen ties to AI
items.standfirst: Acquisition would further expand SoftBank’s investments in artificial intelligence as it tries to center itself in the boomSoftBank Group will acquire digital infrastructure investor DigitalBridge Group in a deal valued at $4bn, the companies said on Monday, as the Japanese investment firm looks to deepen its AI-related portfolio.The acquisition would expand SoftBank’s exposure to digital infrastructure as the Japanese conglomerate is positioning its portfolio to focus on artificial intelligence. SoftBank’s billionaire founder Masayoshi Son is seeking to capitalize on surging demand for the computing capacity that underpins artificial intelligence applications. Continue reading...
items.content: Acquisition would further expand SoftBank’s investments in artificial intelligence as it tries to center itself in the boomSoftBank Group will acquire digital infrastructure investor DigitalBridge Group in a deal valued at $4bn, the companies said on Monday, as the Japanese investment firm looks to deepen its AI-related portfolio.The acquisition would expand SoftBank’s exposure to digital infrastructure as the Japanese conglomerate is positioning its portfolio to focus on artificial intelligence. SoftBank’s billionaire founder Masayoshi Son is seeking to capitalize on surging demand for the computing capacity that underpins artificial intelligence applications. Continue reading...

items.title: SoftBank to Buy Data Center Firm DigitalBridge for $3 Billion
items.standfirst: SoftBank Group Corp. agreed to buy private equity firm DigitalBridge Group Inc. for about $3 billion in cash, part of the Japanese conglomerate’s push to invest in data centers and other digital infrastructure fueling the artificial intelligence boom.
items.content: SoftBank Group Corp. agreed to buy private equity firm DigitalBridge Group Inc. for about $3 billion in cash, part of the Japanese conglomerate’s push to invest in data centers and other digital infrastructure fueling the artificial intelligence boom.

items.title: SoftBank Nears Deal for Data Center Investment Firm DigitalBridge

clusters.title: Arms deal with Taiwan is a bargaining chip for Trump in negotiations with China
clusters.neutral_headline: China launches live-fire drills around Taiwan simulating blockade of major ports

items.title: Arms deal with Taiwan is a bargaining chip for Trump in negotiations with China
items.standfirst: As China holds military drills around Taiwan to deter what it calls separatist forces, why is it happening now? Several reasons include the United States' multi-billion arms deal to Taipei, at a time where the Trump administration is trying to woe the Chinese government on trade. While the US is bound by law to protect Taipei, Trump also sees it as a bargaining chip. FRANCE 24's Philip Turle tells us more.
items.content: As China holds military drills around Taiwan to deter what it calls separatist forces, why is it happening now? Several reasons include the United States' multi-billion arms deal to Taipei, at a time where the Trump administration is trying to woe the Chinese government on trade. While the US is bound by law to protect Taipei, Trump also sees it as a bargaining chip. FRANCE 24's Philip Turle tells us more.

items.title: Chinese military drills a warning to 'separatist forces' and 'external interference' in Taiwan
items.standfirst: China has launched sea and air military drills around Taiwan, which it claims as its own. Riled by a US arms package to the island nation and Japan saying it would intervene in the case of an invasion, it calls its war games a warning against what it calls separatist forces and external interference. The drills are the sixth carried out in Taiwan's vicinity since 2022, adding to fears an invasion could happen in the next few years.
items.content: China has launched sea and air military drills around Taiwan, which it claims as its own. Riled by a US arms package to the island nation and Japan saying it would intervene in the case of an invasion, it calls its war games a warning against what it calls separatist forces and external interference. The drills are the sixth carried out in Taiwan's vicinity since 2022, adding to fears an invasion could happen in the next few years.

items.title: China launches live-fire drills around Taiwan simulating blockade of major ports
items.standfirst: Taipei condemns exercise that Chinese army calls ‘a stern warning’ against separatist and external forcesChina has launched live-fire military drills around Taiwan, simulating a blockade of major ports, attacking maritime targets, and fending off international “interference”, in what it calls a warning to “separatist” forces in Taiwan.The People’s Liberation Army (PLA) – the military wing of the ruling Communist party in China – sent its navy, air force, rocket force and coastguard to surround Taiwan on Monday morning for a surprise exercise called “Justice Mission 2025”, which began less than an hour after it was announced. Continue reading...
items.content: Taipei condemns exercise that Chinese army calls ‘a stern warning’ against separatist and external forcesChina has launched live-fire military drills around Taiwan, simulating a blockade of major ports, attacking maritime targets, and fending off international “interference”, in what it calls a warning to “separatist” forces in Taiwan.The People’s Liberation Army (PLA) – the military wing of the ruling Communist party in China – sent its navy, air force, rocket force and coastguard to surround Taiwan on Monday morning for a surprise exercise called “Justice Mission 2025”, which began less than an hour after it was announced. Continue reading...

items.title: Chinese drills around Taiwan after US and Japan show support towards the island
items.standfirst: China this morning conducted live-fire military drills in waters around Taiwan, aimed, it says, as a warning against separatist forces in the self-ruled island. Codenamed "Justice Mission 2025", the drills come just ten days after the Trump administration announced Washington's largest ever arms package for Taipei, and Japan's claim that it would intervene in the event of China attacking Taiwan.
items.content: China this morning conducted live-fire military drills in waters around Taiwan, aimed, it says, as a warning against separatist forces in the self-ruled island. Codenamed "Justice Mission 2025", the drills come just ten days after the Trump administration announced Washington's largest ever arms package for Taipei, and Japan's claim that it would intervene in the event of China attacking Taiwan.

items.title: China holds military drills around Taiwan as warning to 'separatist forces'
items.standfirst: The drills come days after the US announced the sale of one of its largest weapons packages to Taiwan.
items.content: The drills come days after the US announced the sale of one of its largest weapons packages to Taiwan.

items.title: Chinese aircraft and navy conduct drills around Taiwan in warning against 'external interference'
items.standfirst: China has conducted more military drills around Taiwan in a warning against "external interference".
items.content: China has conducted more military drills around Taiwan in a warning against "external interference".

clusters.title: Trump says he’d ‘love to fire’ Jerome Powell in latest attack on Fed chair
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump says he’d ‘love to fire’ Jerome Powell in latest attack on Fed chair

items.title: Trump says he’d ‘love to fire’ Jerome Powell in latest attack on Fed chair
items.standfirst: Trump also repeated false claims about renovation costs for the Fed headquarters during a Monday press conferenceDonald Trump launched another attack against Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell on Monday, calling the central banker a “fool” and once again suggesting he would like to fire him.Trump launched his latest attack on Powell during a press conference with Israel’s prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu, repeating false claims about the cost of a renovation of the central bank headquarters, and told reporters that he might file a lawsuit against Powell for “gross incompetence”. Continue reading...
items.content: Trump also repeated false claims about renovation costs for the Fed headquarters during a Monday press conferenceDonald Trump launched another attack against Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell on Monday, calling the central banker a “fool” and once again suggesting he would like to fire him.Trump launched his latest attack on Powell during a press conference with Israel’s prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu, repeating false claims about the cost of a renovation of the central bank headquarters, and told reporters that he might file a lawsuit against Powell for “gross incompetence”. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump again floats firing Fed Chair Jerome Powell before his term expires
items.standfirst: At a news conference on Monday, President Trump again stated his desire to fire Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, whose term expires in May. While some contenders to replace him have been floated, the president has made clear he wants whoever the next head of the central bank is to continue cutting interest rates. Business reporter Erin Delmore joins with analysis.
items.content: At a news conference on Monday, President Trump again stated his desire to fire Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, whose term expires in May. While some contenders to replace him have been floated, the president has made clear he wants whoever the next head of the central bank is to continue cutting interest rates. Business reporter Erin Delmore joins with analysis.

clusters.title: Idris Elba knighted in new year honours list also featuring Torvill and Dean
clusters.neutral_headline: Idris Elba knighted in new year honours list also featuring Torvill and Dean

items.title: Idris Elba knighted in new year honours list also featuring Torvill and Dean
items.standfirst: Meera Syal also made dame while England women’s football and rugby winners feature prominentlyThe actors Idris Elba and Meera Syal have been made a knight and a dame in the new year honours list, with top awards also going to the ice skaters Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean.The former head of NHS England, Amanda Pritchard, was also made a dame and there were knighthoods for Patrick McCabe, a former UN official responsible for clearing unexploded bombs in Gaza; Tristram Hunt, the former Labour MP and now director of the V&A, for services to museums; and Roy Clarke, creator of the sitcoms Last of the Summer Wine, Open All Hours and Keeping Up Appearances. Continue reading...
items.content: Meera Syal also made dame while England women’s football and rugby winners feature prominentlyThe actors Idris Elba and Meera Syal have been made a knight and a dame in the new year honours list, with top awards also going to the ice skaters Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean.The former head of NHS England, Amanda Pritchard, was also made a dame and there were knighthoods for Patrick McCabe, a former UN official responsible for clearing unexploded bombs in Gaza; Tristram Hunt, the former Labour MP and now director of the V&A, for services to museums; and Roy Clarke, creator of the sitcoms Last of the Summer Wine, Open All Hours and Keeping Up Appearances. Continue reading...

items.title: Meera Syal, Gabby Logan and Richard Osman among new year honours in arts and media
items.standfirst: Syal becomes a dame, Last of the Summer Wine writer Roy Clarke gets knighthood and Paul Elliott awarded MBEThe creator of some of British television’s most beloved sitcoms, a Match of the Day presenter and a Chuckle Brother are among the figures from the arts and media to be recognised in the new year honours list.Roy Clarke, who created some of the most popular BBC shows of the previous century, has been honoured with a knighthood. He has had a huge impact on British television, creating shows including Last of the Summer Wine, Keeping Up Appearances and Open All Hours. Continue reading...
items.content: Syal becomes a dame, Last of the Summer Wine writer Roy Clarke gets knighthood and Paul Elliott awarded MBEThe creator of some of British television’s most beloved sitcoms, a Match of the Day presenter and a Chuckle Brother are among the figures from the arts and media to be recognised in the new year honours list.Roy Clarke, who created some of the most popular BBC shows of the previous century, has been honoured with a knighthood. He has had a huge impact on British television, creating shows including Last of the Summer Wine, Keeping Up Appearances and Open All Hours. Continue reading...

items.title: Sarina Wiegman an honorary dame as Lionesses and Red Roses get honours
items.standfirst: Leah Williamson made an OBE; four Lionesses are MBEsTorvill and Dean now a dame and a knightSarina Wiegman has been awarded an honorary damehood after guiding England to back-to-back European titles, in a new year honours list dominated by the Lionesses and England’s victorious women’s rugby union team.The Red Roses’ World Cup success on home soil has led to the captain, Zoe Aldcroft, the vice-captain, Marlie Packer, and the head coach, John Mitchell, named OBEs, while Megan Jones, Sadia Kabeya and Ellie Kildunne become MBEs. Continue reading...
items.content: Leah Williamson made an OBE; four Lionesses are MBEsTorvill and Dean now a dame and a knightSarina Wiegman has been awarded an honorary damehood after guiding England to back-to-back European titles, in a new year honours list dominated by the Lionesses and England’s victorious women’s rugby union team.The Red Roses’ World Cup success on home soil has led to the captain, Zoe Aldcroft, the vice-captain, Marlie Packer, and the head coach, John Mitchell, named OBEs, while Megan Jones, Sadia Kabeya and Ellie Kildunne become MBEs. Continue reading...

items.title: George Clooney and wife Amal granted French citizenship
items.standfirst: The actor said privacy laws protecting children from paparazzi were a key factor in the family’s decisionGeorge Clooney has been granted French citizenship, along with his wife Amal Clooney and their two children, according to an official decree in France’s government gazette.The publication confirms an ambition Clooney alluded to early in December when he praised French privacy laws that keep his family shielded from paparazzi. Continue reading...

What has happened? Continue reading...
items.content: British-Egyptian activist has apologised over tweets appearing to condone violence against Zionists and policeThe human rights campaigner Alaa Abd el-Fattah’s past social media posts have led to a widespread backlash since his return from detention in Egypt on Friday. What has happened? Continue reading...

items.title: British-Egyptian rights activist Alaa Abd el-Fattah apologises for ‘hurtful’ tweets
items.standfirst: Campaigner recently released from prison makes statement after PM’s support is questioned by Tory MPsAlaa Abd el-Fattah, the British-Egyptian human rights campaigner, has apologised unreservedly for what he accepted were shocking and hurtful tweets that he wrote more than 10 years ago in what he described as heated online battles.He said he was shaken by the criticism that has rained down on him since the tweets were highlighted by shadow ministers challenging Keir Starmer’s support for him since he was released by the Egyptian government to travel to the UK after his release from more than 10 years in prison. Continue reading...
items.content: Campaigner recently released from prison makes statement after PM’s support is questioned by Tory MPsAlaa Abd el-Fattah, the British-Egyptian human rights campaigner, has apologised unreservedly for what he accepted were shocking and hurtful tweets that he wrote more than 10 years ago in what he described as heated online battles.He said he was shaken by the criticism that has rained down on him since the tweets were highlighted by shadow ministers challenging Keir Starmer’s support for him since he was released by the Egyptian government to travel to the UK after his release from more than 10 years in prison. Continue reading...
